2850.verse: وَإِذَا|And when|85|94|96$بَلَغَ|reach|57|74|5476$ٱلْأَطْفَـٰلُ|the children|98|115|12655$مِنكُمُ|among you|92|109|1599$ٱلْحُلُمَ|the puberty|98|115|12644$فَلْيَسْتَــْٔذِنُواْ|then let them ask permission|210|218|12656$كَمَا|as|53|62|110$ٱسْتَــْٔذَنَ|asked permission|131|148|12657$ٱلَّذِينَ|those who|89|106|20$مِن قَبْلِهِمْ‌ۚ|(were) before them.|154|171|1094$كَذَٲلِكَ|Thus|77|94|702$يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ|Allah makes clear|134|143|1653$لَكُمْ|for you|67|97|207$ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ‌ۗ|His Verses.|93|153|706$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|141|167$عَلِيمٌ|(is) All-Knower|117|177|307$حَكِيمٌ|All-Wise.|78|108|1828$

2851.verse: وَٱلْقَوَٲعِدُ|And postmenopausal|156|173|12658$مِنَ|among|63|98|156$ٱلنِّسَآءِ|the women|93|128|2095$ٱلَّـٰتِى|who|68|103|3869$لَا|(do) not|75|110|30$يَرْجُونَ|have desire|96|113|1912$نِكَاحًا|(for) marriage,|116|134|12533$فَلَيْسَ|then not is|92|129|2210$عَلَيْهِنَّ|on them|82|119|2000$جُنَاحٌ|any blame|87|124|1764$أَن|that|48|85|655$يَضَعْنَ|they put aside|116|134|12659$ثِيَابَهُنَّ|their (outer) garments,|173|194|12660$غَيْرَ|not|61|104|560$مُتَبَرِّجَـٰتِۭ|displaying|112|155|12661$بِزِينَةٍ‌ۖ|their adornment.|130|173|12662$وَأَن|And that|78|99|1470$يَسْتَعْفِفْنَ|they modestly refrain|161|186|12663$خَيْرٌ|(is) better|88|137|520$لَّهُنَّ‌ۗ|for them.|81|130|1630$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|130|167$سَمِيعٌ|(is) All-Hearer,|117|142|1573$عَلِيمٌ|All-Knower.|95|95|307$

2850.verse: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

2851.verse: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

2852.verse: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.
